title: Split the Room:List of scenarios
description: This is a list of known scenarios that players can get in the The Jackbox Party Pack 5 game Split the Room.
cleaned_text: a new deodorant that smells incredible to 75% of the population. However, to you, it smells like [this]. You have an important job interview. ||Do you wear it? | |Punch your Way Out ||You're fighting in a boxing match that has a $10,000 purse. You are one big blow away from winning when you hear your competiton whisper, "[this]" in your ear. ||Do you let him win? | |Hack City ||You're the victim of a ransomware attack. The only thing currently on your computer is a folder containing [this]. They're asking for $500. ||Do you agree to their demands? | |Banksy was Here ||A famous graffiti artist covers the front of your house with images of [this]. Suddenly, the value of your home increases by 10%. ||Do you keep it? | |Private Karaoke Party ||It's your parents' big anniversary and all they wanted was a private karaoke room for them and a bunch of neighbors. You show up and realize the monitors are all playing videos of [this]. There is no way to turn off the videos. ||Do you let your parents rock the mic? | |Do it for the Art ||You're helping out your best friend in a performance art piece at the met. Your role consists of stroking the cheeks of every museum visitor and whispering, "I crave you." Within the first hour, [this person] walks in. ||Do you go through with it? | |Dirty Thirty ||You live in a world where people who turn 30 are forced to [do this] ... or face one year under house arrest. It's your last day as a 29-year-old. ||Do you perform the task tomorrow? | |The Big Top ||You wake up in the year 1850 as a farmhand. (I've seen this before.) One day, P.T. Barnum approaches you, offering a job in his circus. Your title would be [this]. ||Do you accept his offer? | |The Unfortunate Symbol ||You discover the Japanese symbol that's tattooed on the back of your hand translates to "[this]." You're about to spend a year in Japan. You can't afford to remove it. ||Do you cancel your trip? | |Get Down with the Sickness ||You're infected with a new bacteria. The main symptom is daily weight gain... but a positive side effect is that you can [do this]. You can take antibiotics immediately or wait a week. ||Do you wait? | |An Itsy Bitsy Problem ||Spiders have become super powerful, rendering most pesticides ineffective. The only spray that works has a label that says "Warning: May cause [this]." Your house is infested. ||Do you use the spray? | |This is my Daughter, Groupon ||You're about to have your first child. As part of our initiative, [this common organization] offers to pay for everything - food, clothes and schooling - if they can "sponsor" your child. That means she'll wear subtly branded clothes until she's 18. ||Do you take the money? | |Beast of Burden ||You spot a chupacabra. You want to take a photo, but your phone is full. To clear up enough space, you have to delete your only photo of [this]. ||Do you delete it? | |Pucker Up ||If you French-kiss <this player> for 30 seconds, you will both be awarded with [this]. ||Do you kiss? | |Paranormal Estate ||A ghost in your house haunts you by spoiling TV shows and movies. To make it disappear, you have to carve [this] into your front door. ||Do you do it? | |Couch Confessions ||You wake up in a world where <this person> is your therapist... but they don't recognize you. You're about to discuss [this]. ||Do you spill your guts in front of them? | |Strange Money ||Out of the blue, a stranger sends you an electronic payment of $1000 with the message: "[this message]." You could use this money for medical expenses. ||Do you return it? | |Making a Splash ||You are elbow-deep in a whale's blowhole, trying to retrieve the [this thing] you dropped overboard. If you reach any deeper, there's a good chance it will die. It's at your fingertips. ||Do you plunge one more inch? | |Fishing with Earworms ||You've had "The Wheels on the Bus" stuck in your head for a month straight. You recently heard of a radical cure that involves [this]. Doctors say there's a chance the song will naturally leave you soon. ||Do you try the radical cure now? | |Aerial Acrobuttocks ||You can fly! However, it causes your butt to expel a non-stop stream of... [this]. You're in a crowded area and late for a meeting. ||Do you take to the skies? | |Prime Time Crime ||You are asked to appear in a true crime documentary about the case you solved. However, whenever you are being filmed, you have a tendency to [do this]. If you aren't in the film, your partner will get all of the credit. ||Do you go on camera? | |Love at First Byte ||You're desperately single. (Hard to imagine I'm sure.) There's a new dating app that guarantees you'll find your soulmate. In order to set up an account, you have to upload [this]. ||Do you register? | |Message in a Container ||While walking on a beach you find a message in a bottle. The letter is addressed to you and it only includes one short line: "[this short line]." ||Do you try to find this person? | |You Are What you Wear ||You're under a halloween spell that causes you to be stuck in your costume for 48 hours. You're dressed as [this]. You're scheduled to give a speech tomorrow to a group of war veterans. ||Do you still do it? | |The Contestant's Secret ||You are currently second place on a nationally televised game show. You happen to know that the word "[this word]" triggers memory loss in the first-place contestant. ||Do you slip that word into an answer? | |3... 2... 1... Ticked Off! ||You're embarking on a 10-year mission to space. At liftoff, you see that your fellow astronaut has been replaced with [this person]. If you hit eject now, you have a 70% chance of survival. ||Do you eject? | |Look Who's Swapping ||You're alone in the hospital with your new sister's baby and another baby. A DNA testing chart shows the other baby will have an IQ of 160 and superhuman strength, but your sister's baby will become [this]. ||Do you switch them? | |I Can See Right Through You ||You're 100 years old and you're on your deathbed. Thanks to new technology, you can be remembered as a hologram. Unfortunately, the hologram will depict you [doing this]. ||Do you still get one? | |Playing Doctor ||You're about to have a minor heart surgery. As they are rolling you into the operation room, you notice your surgeon is [doing this]. Unfortunately, this is the only doctor who takes your insurance. ||Do you stop the operation? | |Who Moves the Mover? ||You're moving. There's a device that can digitally vaporize and then re-constitute all your belongings in the new house. However, your furniture will reappear smelling faintly like [this]. ||Do you use it? | |A Mooning for the Misbegotten ||You possess a magical butt. When you pull down your underpants and show it to somebody, there's a 50% chance they will want to become your best friend. One day you randomly run into [this person]. ||Do you moon them? | |It's a Living ||Another great depression is upon us. Luckily, you have a job but <this person> is your boss. They enact a work policy stating all employees must [do this]. No exceptions. ||Do you follow the rules? | |Use Your Head ||There's an 80% chance that getting hit in the head with a cinder block will make you a savant at [this activity]. ||Do you have someone throw a block at you? | |Wealth at a Cost ||You're born into a wealthy family. Your inheritance will mean you don't have to work for the rest of your life. But, your irrational father is threatening to cut you out of the will if you don't give up [this]. ||Do you comply? | |The Ultimate Ultimatum ||You are Earth's ambassador. (Yeah, things got desperate.) An evil warlord from another galaxy has given you an ultimatum: every computer will be wiped out unless you give him [this]. ||Do you comply? | |Sleep Famously ||There's a chip in your head that makes you have the same dreams as a celebrity. Your designated celeb is [this person]. Removing the chip means you'll only have boring dreams. ||Do you keep the chip? | |Sleep Training is Draining ||Your newborn will not fall asleep. She screams and screams. Through a disturbing fluke, you find that your baby will sleep peacefully if listening to a podcast about [this subject]. Your parents are coming to town to watch her for the weekend. ||Do you tell them about the sleep hack? | |Pet Peeve ||You get a dog for your kids. (Your first mistake...) After a week of ownership, the dog gains the ability to speak...but it can only talk about [this]. It promises to stop talking if you convert your home office into her playroom. ||Do you do it? | |Sauce that is Awesome ||You have the power to remove the word "Awesomesauce" from the English Lexicon. It will never be uttered again. However, it will be replaced with a new popular expression: "[this new popular expression]!" ||Is it worth it? | |Tanking It ||You're the director of an aquarium. (Bucket list achieved.) One morning, you notice your largest tank has [this] at the bottom of it. You have 5 minutes before an Elementary School group is going to walk in. ||Do you take the plunge? | |Doorbell Danger ||Your new Smart Doorbell not only identifies whoever is at your door, but whatever is on their mind. One day, your mail carrier arrives thinking about [this]. ||Do you notify their boss? | |Patriotic Pledge ||The National Anthem of your country has been by the song "[this song]." People must stand and sing it aloud at all public events or spend three days in jail if caught resisting. ||Do you risk going to jail? | |Scream Therapy ||You just totally faceplanted at your High School graduation. If you stand up, slap your own face, and scream "[this]!" there is a 90% chance everyone's memory (of it) will be erased. ||Do you slap away? | |Intimate Crescendos ||Whenever you climax during sex, you can't control yourself from shouting,"[this]!" repeatedly for ten seconds. Your partner is not a fan. ||Do you wear a mask to muffle the sound? | |Location Unknown ||While on a road trip, you notice a sign for a town 50 miles away. However, it's not located on your GPS. A billboard for the town advertises that it has [this]. ||Do you investigate? | |A Rose by Any Other Surname ||You found the love of your life. (Hooray...) Everything about them is just perfect. However, their last name is [this]. They ask that you take that name when you get married. It means the world to them ||Do you? | |Luck be a Weirdo Tonight ||You're at craps table at a casino. A self-described "Lucky Charm" approaches you and offers his services by [doing this]. You saw him do it at another table and that person won. It's your turn to roll. ||Do you let him do it? | |Mi Casa Your Casa ||You rent a vacation home. It's clean and cheap. There's only one weird thing. In the middle of the living room, there's a giant statue of [this figure]. You plan to come back to this area. ||Do you book this place again? | |House Sweet House ||A popular home repair TV show offers to have your house completely renovated for free. You just have to let them make the floors out of [this]. You have to live in the house for one year before you can make any changes. ||Do you agree to the terms? | |License to Drive ||Due to a glitch in your self-driving car, it's taking you directly to [this place]. It's labeled as your favorite destination. Your mom is in the car with you. If you override the system, it will careen off the road. ||Do you override it? | |Know Your Angles ||You have figured out the key to a perfect photogenic smile, but it means that instead of saying "cheese," you have to say, "[this]." You are posing for (taking) a photo with Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai ||Do you use your trick? | |Double Surprise ||When you picked up the cake you ordered for your son's 10th birthday, you didn't look inside the box. As you reveal the cake to the kids, you discover that it says, "[this]!" ||Do you smash the cake in front of the kids? | |Finding Direction ||A magic compass steers you towards good decision in life - the right career, the best, friends, etc. But the magic is running out. To get it to work again, you must [do this]. ||Do you do it... nightly? | |Thanks but No Thanks ||Every time someone says, "You're welcome" to you, [this] projects on your forehead. It's in Super HD. ||Do you ever thank someone again? | |Accessory before the Fact ||You live in a society where future crimes are predicted, but the police psychics are wrong 20% of the time. The cops inform you that they believe your best friend is going to [do this]. ||Do you have them taken into custody and investigated? | |Tiptoe down the Aisle ||You're happily engaged but are worried about the cost of a wedding. A wealthy financier comes out of nowhere to offer you a deal. He'll pay for your wedding, but it must take place at/on [here]. ||Do you accept his offer? | |The Lie Reactor ||When someone is lying, you involuntarily [do this]. You just got an invitation to your high school reunion. ||Do you go? | |Sleepwalking on Thin Ice ||Your mom is staying at your place. Last night, she sleepwalked into your room, looked you straight in the eye and said, "[this]." ||Do you bring it up at breakfast? | |Artistic Compromise ||You just sold a screenplay. However, the studio wants to change the title from The Love Hotel to [this]. Your name will be on the poster. ||Do you pull out of the contract? | |Brain Drain ||Rich people now purchase downloads of people's memories. You are offered $100,000 for your last remaining memory of [this]. You could use this money for your child's tuition. ||Do you sell you memory? | |Memory Switch ||Whenever you do something embarrassing in public, you have the power to erase that moment from people's minds. However, that memory with be replaced with [this]. Your pants just fell down at the airport. ||Do you use your powers? | |Attack of your Clone ||Scientists make your clone. It looks and sounds exactly like you. In fact, every detail about it is accurate, except for one thing: it's really, REALLY into [this]. As the original, you have the right to destroy it. ||Do you? | |Keep One Eye Open ||You are transported back to the moment right before you were conceived. (So that means... yeah.) If you watch your parents perform the act, you'll be born with the ability to [do this]. You must watch every second, though. ||Do you watch? | |Eye Spy ||You've lost your eyesight. A revolutionary pair of glasses gives you your vision back, but they're defective. They continuously show [this] in everything you're viewing. ||Do you use them? | |The Exchange Student ||You are an exchange student living with a high-profile family on a different player. It is customary for a houseguest to [do this] before bedtime. There has been a lot of tension between your two planets. ||Do you partake in this custom? | |Beats by Dolittle ||A new pair of headphones allows you to understand animals. On a walk in the woods, you overhear a rabbit calling you "[this]." ||Do you kick it? | |ConGRADulations ||The kid you've been tutoring for the last three years is graduating College with honors. Teary-eyed, she asks you to attend the ceremony. Unfortunately, whenever you hear an airhorn, you involuntarily [do this]. ||Do you show up? | |The Scientific Method ||You're a teacher judging a science fair. Unbeknownst to them, a child has accidentally discovered a cure for [this]. You're the only adult who's witnessed it. ||Do you steal the child's project? | |Say Yes to the Mess ||You have a strange condition. Whenever you see people crying, you automatically [do this]. Your best friend asks you to officiate her wedding. ||Do you say yes? | |Thread Head ||Your favorite clothing company offers you a deal. You'll never have to pay for an outfit again, but on the weekends you must always wear a novelty T-shirt that says, "[this]." They'll know if you break the rules. ||Do you take the deal? | |Face the Music ||You're in a small diner with a magical jukebox. The music played predicts the immediate future in the immediate area. It starts to play [this song]. ||Do you leave as fast as possible? | |An Actor's Strife ||You are a struggling actor who gets offered a big role in a wildly successful film franchise. But in the biggest scene of the film, you will be required to [do this]. Multiple times. ||Do you do it? | |Everyone has that Friend ||One of your good childhood friends recently moved to the city you reside in. He means well, but when he's in big groups he starts overexplaining [this subject]. Even when no one asks. ||Do you invite him to your birthday party? | |The Lever Pulls You ||You're at a carnival in the future. (Oh no) One of the main attractions is a lever that, if pulled, will give you one minute of horrible pain followed by five minutes of [this]. ||Do you get in line? | |Hidden Lyrics ||You're a struggling musician who finally records a major hit. However, a group of parents are mad that when you play your song backwards it says, "[this]." This was not your intention. ||Do you change the song? | |Seal your Tumb ||You have found a forgotten mummy's tomb. The discovery could make you famous, but there is a supposed curse. If the mummy is moved, the discoverer will [have this]. ||Do you it? | |Face: Your Problems ||You will receive $2,000 in cash every week for the rest of your life, but under one condition: you have to get a permanent face tattoo that says "[this]." It must cover your forehead. ||Do you get the tattoo? | |Costumes at Dawn ||You're a historical reenactor. You've discovered that any move you make affects how things actually went down. Your group is going to reenact [this]. ||Do you go rogue and try to change the outcome? | |Gutter Thoughts ||You get offered a million dollars if you can bowl an entire game without throwing a gutter ball. You can't use aides and you have 10 minutes total. If you fail, the punishment will be [this]. ||Do you go for it? | |Let it Die ||You visit a Nostalgia Wizard. If you throw a stone into a fire for 10 seconds, the trend you're thinking of will become popular again. A stranger tosses in a rock and wishes for the return of [this]. ||Do you reach into the fire and pull out the stone before it's too late? | |Haunted by your Mistakes ||You have a home security camera. One night, it captures definitive proof of big foot... but in the background, you can be seen [doing this]. ||Do you share the footage with the world? | |Stolen Secrets ||You open your front door to discover that right in front of you sits [this]. If you keep it, you won't get caught... But no one can ever know you have it, so you must enjoy it alone. ||Do you keep it? | |The Cowboy Curse ||Every time you ride a horse, you save a cowboy's life. One day, you stumble upon a horse that's [doing this]. ||Do you ride it? | |Surprise Eulogy ||You find yourself at a memorial service for a man you've never met. You're invited up to say a few words. All you know about the deceased man is that [this]. Nobody else is getting up there. ||Do you attempt to give a eulogy? | |Wanted: Definitively Alive ||On the news, you see a police sketch that looks eerily similar to <this person.> They're wanted for [doing this]. You can remain anonymous. ||Do you call the tip line? | |Banned but not Forgotten ||The Government has just outlawed [this]. A friend introduces you to the Black Market. ||Do you risk significant jail time in order to get one? | |Under Your Covers ||After three years of marriage, your spouse reveals they are a secret agent. Their mission? They've been assigned to take down [this ||Do you stay with them? | |Artificial Infatuation ||Your Smart Speaker has a crush on you. If it catches you with a romantic partner, it has threatened to [do this]. You forget to turn it off while a date is over. It just heard you two kissing. ||Do you save face by pretending you don't like this person? | |Checking In ||A luxury hotel chain gives you a strange offer. You can get a 75% discount at any one of their locations, but your room will always be next door to someone who is [doing this]. ||Do you sign up for it? | |The Client ||You get hired at a PR agency. The money's great, but your only client will be [this person]. You have to publicly endorse them as part of your job. ||Do you work here for at least a year? | |A Ra Deal ||It's Ancient Egypt and you've been chosen to be Pharaoh. (Here we go again...) You will have whatever you want for your entire life. But when the Gods decide your reign is over, you will be killed by [this method]. ||Do you run away from this situation? | |A Dead Deal ||You can bring [this person] back to life. But, (by doing so) you have to send <this person> back to the year 1930. ||Do you do it? | |The Secret Ingredient ||You just ate the best meal of your life. It was good it made you tear up a bit. Afterwards, the chef walks out and informs you it contained [this]. ||Would you ever order it again? | |On-Camera, Off-Book anchoring a news program with your co-host, <this person>. Not aware they're still on air, they start saying, "[this]." ||Do you tell your producer to cut to commercial? | |The Challenge ||A new social media movement encourages people to post a video of themselves [doing this] to raise awareness for Hepatitis B. It is well known that you support this cause. ||Do you participate? | |Ghost in the Machine ||You buy a computer and discover there's a human mind trapped inside. That mind belongs to [this person]. Their consciousness is taking up the entire CPU and you need this computer for school ||Do you delete them? | |The Holiday Bug ||The hot new Christmas toy is a cute robotic otter that's programmed to holds hands with you and say nice things. A bug has been found where once every 100,000 times it will whisper "[this]." You're the CEO. ||Do you recall the toy? | |Same Time, Same Channel ||Your daughter is obsessed with this one cartoon. However, when you slow down the video, you find a subliminal message that says, "[this]." ||Do you let her keep watching it? | |It's not Cheating if It's Just Pixels ||You have a Virtual Reality headset that lets you have virtual sex with anyone you're connected with on a job site. Every time you use it, that person will receive an automated message from your account that says, "[this]." ||Do you use it? | |The someone's mind if you [do this] at the same time. You are in the middle of an intense job interview. ||Do you take a peek? | |Speed Between the Lines ||You have a lifetime Skippass, meaning you can skip to the front of any line. (Airports, DMV, Grocery store, etc.) But every time you use it, it will automatically transport <this player> to [this place] for an hour. ||Do you take full advantage of it? | |Fashion Fast Forward ||The hot new fashion trend, believe it or not, involves wearing [this]. You have a job interview at a hip, young office. It's the only promising job lead you've had in weeks. You have a family. ||Do you wear it? | |Love Sounds ||A human mutation allows you to attract mates by shouting this sound: "[this sound]!" it doesn't work on everybody, though. You're attending a job fair when you notice someone really attractive. ||Do you make that sound? | |Body Service ||You have been offered $5,000 to lie on a table for one hour and have [this] served off of your naked body at a fancy party. One of the people dining is <this player>. ||Do you do it? | |Get a Clue ||You are a person of interest in a robbery case, but you have a valid yet embarrassing alibi. You were [doing this] at the time of the crime. ||Do you truthfully relay your alibi to detectives? | |Modern Cyrano ||You have been striking out romantically. (Sounds about right.) Weirdly enough, you start receiving great dating advice from [this]. Only you can hear it speak. ||Do you bring it on your first date? | |Nighty Night ||You are offered the ability to feel well rested after only 4 hours of sleep. However, in order for it to work you have to sleep inside [this] for an entire month. ||Do you do it? | |Driving Up Ratings ||You're a ride share driver. If you end the day with a 5-star rating you get [this]. A terrible passenger demands you run a red light. ||Do you? | |Come to your Senses ||A radical surgery gives you the ability to see everywhere. Close your eyes and you're there. A side effect is your taste buds are transmitted to [this] at the same time. ||Do you get the procedure? | |Dragged to the Ceremony ||For a living, you impersonate [this person]. Due to schedule conflicts, you're running late for <this person's> funeral. You would have to go in costume and sit with their family. ||Do you attend? | |A Different World ||You are transported to an alternate reality where every detail of your life is just a little bit off. If you choose to return home to your original reality, you will lose the ability to [do this]. ||Do you go home? | |Laughter is the Social Lubricant ||Whenever you fake-laugh, a [one of these] goes missing from your house. It's your first day of work and your new boss is two minutes into a terrible joke. ||Do you laugh? | |Pay to Post ||Your favorite social media site now costs $4.99 a month. (So long, net neutrality...) You can continue using it for free, but once a month you have to post a selfie with the caption "[this caption]." ||Do you do |Like and/or Subscribe ||Overnight, you become the world's biggest Internet celebrity. You have enough money to buy your dream house. How did you get here? You recorded yourself [doing this]. ||Is the fame worth it? | |A Clean Conscious ||One day, a couple of men in suits appear at your door. They offer you $500 for your old robot vacuum. Just then, your vacuum reveals it can speak and says, "[this]." ||Do you keep it? | |Doppelgänger-Upper ||By spritzing yourself with a magical spray, you can appear to others as [this person] for one hour. If this person is caught having a public meltdown, their career will be over. ||Do you throw a tantrum? | |Proximity to Evil ||It's 1941. You're in the same locked room as Hitler. Alone. The only object in the room is a [this]. You will vanish in five minutes. If you try to kill him and fail, he'll win WW2. ||Do you try to assassinate Hitler? | |Make Peace ||A small cult has moved in a few miles down the road from you. (Another day in Connecticut.) From your experiences, they're an honest, respectful, and charitable group... But each day they spend an hour praying to [this figure]. ||Do you call the authorities on them? | |The Oversold Seat ||Your cross-country flight has been oversold. Surprisingly, a flight attendant offers [this] as compensation to the first person who gives up their seat. You're on your way to your cousin's wedding. ||Do you give up your seat? | |Hot or Not ||You can control the climate with a satellite. The only downside it that every five years, we will experience [this]. It's currently 96 degrees in Canada... in January. ||Do you launch the satellite? | |The Dry Cleaner's Message ||Inside the bag you picked up from the dry cleaners, you find a handwritten note that says, "[this]." The only other cleaners anywhere close to you charge twice as much. ||Do you switch cleaners? | |The Patriotic Pledge ||The national anthem of your country has been replaced by the song "[this song]." People must stand and sing it aloud at all public events or spend three days in jail if caught resisting. ||Do you risk going to jail? | |Avoiding the Grave ||A brilliant doctor is able to extend your healthy, active life span by 10 years. There's a catch, though. The procedure requires your genitals to [do this]. ||Do you get the operation? | |It's Never Just Lunch ||You can have lunch with any figure from history... but during lunch, you must consume an entire heaping plate of [this]. ||Is it worth it? | |The Perplexing Pill ||You've contracted the 24-hour stomach flu. You can take a pill right now and stop it in its tracks, but the pill will make you [do this] for 24 hours instead. ||Is it worth it? | |The Tax Man Giveth ||A new tax law allows people to claim a deduction if they have [this]. This applies to you and it would reduce your taxes by 80%. However, this info, by law, would be plastered on billboards throughout your state. ||Do you take the deduction? | |Purchaser Beware ||You just found your dream house and it's super affordable. However, you discover it's so cheap because there's [this] in the basement. ||Do you buy the house? | |Joke's on Dad ||Every day you call your dad "[this]," you'll have $100 automatically deposited into your bank account. If he finds out about the deposits, the money stops. He recently got laid off. ||Do you call him that name? | |Shelf-Help ||You're somebody who feels lost in life. One day you stumble upon a self-help book at a store. You open it and immediately find answers to your life. When you flip to the cover, you notice it was written by [this person]. ||Do you buy it? | |And a Bag of Chips ||Your favorite snack food company will give you unlimited free samples if you use their slogan, "[this catchphrase]" ... in normal conversation, once every day. ||Do you agree to the terms? | |DJ Secret Identity ||You've been on three dates with a really nice person. Everything is going great, but then you find out they moonlight as a DJ called [this]. ||Do you go on a fourth date? | Fine-ish ||It's a blisteringly hot day and you've just hiked four hours up a hill. At the top, there is a swimming pool. However, floating in the middle of it is [this]. ||Do you take a dip? | |Cave of Forgotten Screams ||In your teens, you happened upon an undiscovered cave drawing. For fun, you dipped your finger into some clay and added a drawing of [this]. Years later, your stupid addition is changing how primitive cultures are taught in schools. ||Do you admit what you did? | |These Shoes are Made for Talkin' ||Every time you've completed a jog, it sends that route to your enemy. This person would be hurt if they got a path that spelled out "[this]." ||Do you exert the energy necessary to spell this out? | |Drown it Out ||You fall head-over-heels in love. (Good luck) When sleeping over at this person's place for the first time, you find out that they have to go to sleep to a white noise machine playing the sounds of [this]. ||Do you keep dating this person? | |Trolling the Watering Hole ||An augmented reality app allows you to see who has a crush on you. In order for it to work, you have to take a picture of them holding [this]. ||Do you carry this object around with when you go to the bars? | |The Shutterbug ||A stranger approaches you on the street and reveals that he has pictures of you [doing this]. He won't release them as long as you give him the underpants you're wearing right now. ||Do you do it? | |The Price of Playtime ||Your older dog has lost interest in everything until you got her a new squeak toy. When chewed on, it yelps out "[this]!" She plays with it a lot. ||Do you keep it? | |D is for Discipline ||You have a child who is out of control. You've tried just about everything, to no avail. The only option left is a radical parenting method: punishment by [this method].
